channel.title: Posts on Log4j Exploitability Index
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Log4j Exploitability Index

item.title: Siemens EnergyIP
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link Siemens Advisory - SSA-661257: Apache Log4j Vulnerabilities https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Resources Resource Link source https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL CVE-2021-4104: Not vuln ; CVE-2021-44228: Fix NCSC-NL EnergyIP V8.5 and V8.6 applications are not directly affected, but CAS is.

item.title: Siemens EnergyIP Prepay
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link Siemens Advisory - SSA-661257: Apache Log4j Vulnerabilities https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Resources Resource Link source https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL CVE-2021-44228: Vulnerable CISAGov Specific mitigation information has been released for the customer projects with the request of immediate deployment.

item.title: Siemens Enlighted
item.description: Community Resources Resource Link source https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL CVE-2021-44228: Investigation Sources Date Attribution Description 2021-12-20 12:37:57 NCSC-NL Updated vendorInvestigating. Updated community note. Updated community link source.

item.title: Siemens Enlightened Amaze
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link Siemens Advisory - SSA-661257: Apache Log4j Vulnerabilities https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Notes Source Note CISAGov Vulnerabilities fixed on central cloud services starting 2021-12-10; no user actions necessary. For Comfy and Enlighted, see the Additional Information section and further recommendations from Siemens Advisory SSA-661257 CISAGov Last Update: 12/18/2021 Sources Date Attribution Description 2021-12-18 19:49:41 CISAGov Updated communityVulnerable.

item.title: Siemens GMA-Manager
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link Siemens Advisory - SSA-661257: Apache Log4j Vulnerabilities https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Resources Resource Link source https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL CVE-2021-4104: Not vuln ; CVE-2021-44228: Fix CISAGov Update to V8.6.2-472 or later version. Block both incoming and outgoing connections between the system and the Internet.

item.title: Siemens HES UDIS
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link Siemens Advisory - SSA-661257: Apache Log4j Vulnerabilities https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Resources Resource Link source https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL CVE-2021-44228: Vulnerable CISAGov Currently no remediation is available. Specific mitigation information has been released for the local project teams with the request of immediate deployment.

item.title: Siemens Industrial Edge Management App (IEM-App)
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link Siemens Advisory - SSA-661257: Apache Log4j Vulnerabilities https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Resources Resource Link source https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL CVE-2021-44228: Vulnerable CISAGov Exposure to vulnerability is limited as IEM-App runs in IEM-OS and IEM-OS is not intended to be exposed to public internet and should be operated in a protected environment.

item.title: Siemens Industrial Edge Management Hub

See further recommendations from Siemens Advisory SSA-661257 CISAGov Last Update: 12/18/2021 Sources Date Attribution Description 2021-12-18 19:49:41 CISAGov Updated communityVulnerable.

item.title: Siemens LOGO! Soft Comfort
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link Siemens Advisory - SSA-661257: Apache Log4j Vulnerabilities https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Resources Resource Link source https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL CVE-2021-44228: Not vuln CISAGov Note: LOGO! Soft Comfort products were previously listed as affected. They were removed after closer investigation showed that they are not affected.

item.title: Siemens Mendix Applications
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link Siemens Advisory - SSA-661257: Apache Log4j Vulnerabilities https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Resources Resource Link source https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL CVE-2021-44228: Vulnerable CISAGov Although the Mendix runtime itself is not vulnerable to this exploit, we nevertheless recommend to upgrade log4j-core to the latest available version if log4j-core is part of your project.

item.title: Siemens Mindsphere Cloud Foundry
item.description: Vendor Resources Resource Link Siemens Advisory - SSA-661257: Apache Log4j Vulnerabilities https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Resources Resource Link source https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-661247.pdf Community Notes Source Note NCSC-NL CVE-2021-44228: Not vuln NCSC-NL Although Cloud Foundry environment itself is not vulnerable, nevertheless it’s recommended to upgrade log4j-core to the latest available version if log4j-core is part of your project CISAGov Although the Cloud Foundry environment itself is not vulnerable to this exploit, we nevertheless recommend to upgrade log4j-core to the latest available version if log4j-core is part of your project.
